meanings.definition: A public box into which mail is put for collection by the postal service.
meanings.sent1: I dropped my letter in the postbox on the corner.
meanings.sent2: The postman emptied the postbox every morning.
meanings.sent3: The postbox looked like a hungry metal mouth waiting for letters to eat.
meanings.sent4: The red postbox stood out on the street like a beacon of communication.
meanings.sent5: The postbox's bright color made it easy to spot from far away.

meanings.definition: To put (a letter or package) into a postbox for mailing.
meanings.sent1: Don't forget to postbox your birthday card before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: She postboxed the important documents without delay.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally postboxed his keys instead of the mail.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like letters postboxed into the hearts of her listeners.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of relief washed over her as she postboxed the last package.
